newsitem.title: JAPAN: NCB president says cannot rule out tie-up, merger.
newsitem.headline: NCB president says cannot rule out tie-up, merger.

text.p: Nippon Credit Bank Ltd (NCB) President Hiroshi Kubota said on Tuesday that he could not rule out the possibility of a tie-up or merger with other banks in the future.
"I would not deny the possibility of a merger or capital participation by other banks," the president of the troubled Japanese long-term credit bank told a news conference.

The NCB president also said that the bank would consider joining foreign bank groups if doing so would boost the bank's business. The president did not give any names of possible candidates for a tie-up or a merger.

The president also said that the combined debts of three NCB non-bank financial affiliates which filed for bankruptcy on Tuesday would result in an overall loss to creditors of around 800-900 billion yen.
